ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned more about the different tenses in Portuguese and how to speak better
Ive learned how to speak, read, write, and listen to the Portuguese language and about Brazilian culture.
I learnt about Brazilian Culture, improved my speaking skills and continued to develop my vocabulary.
I learnt a lot of Portuguese vocab and grammar, but more importantly we practiced a lot! It was helpful to become more comfortable and confident speaking in portuguese only during class.
More knowledge of the Brazilian culture

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course was fun and enjoyable, but a lot of work outside of class that could have been handled better
good introduction to the material. however, more quizzes/tests are needed to help students stay on track. additionally, grading was sometimes unclear

Very fun and engaging during class time. Outside of class, often a lot of work every single day which was sometimes difficult to balance with other classes. Not a lot of clarity about how the class was graded until after the semester finished.

I wish we werent made to talk about topics we had so little vocab to talk about, like class and patrimnio, even though I understand that the point was to learn about not just language but also Brazilian culture. I wish there was separation between deep complex topics (conducted in English so people in the class actually understand and can participate) and the usual language 101 like verb tenses and weekend activities / colors / family. What ended up happening is not delving into any social issue enough and also not knowing some basic spoken phrases.

A lot of culture was learned but not a lot of vocab was practiced. A lot of people ended up having to translate stuff often because we didnt test vocabulary a lot. There was a lot of busy work that was given out for homework that was so time consuming but it didnt really help improve our ability to speak the language.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes I would recommend it to anyone interested in Portuguese
Yes, I think this language is the most fun to learn.
There was work in the sense that its consistent homework, not hard at all
If they are interested in the Brazilian culture I would
